messages.content:
It’s been my privilege to serve our city for many years as a councillor, council leader and Member of Parliament. In that time I have always tried to do right by all of my constituents, no matter who they are or where they are from.

This has become even more important since the vote to leave the European Union. I’ve had to speak out and fight for what’s best for our city and our residents, all of whom will be affected by the decision we have taken.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Alan Whitehead is committed to fighting for the best deal for Southampton in the upcoming Brexit negotiations, ensuring the interests of the city and its residents are protected.
He will fight to protect the rights and futures of EU citizens living in the UK and has been advocating against using EU citizens as bargaining chips in Brexit negotiations.

issues.brexitEurope:
This has become even more important since the vote to leave the European Union. I’ve had to speak out and fight for what’s best for our city and our residents, all of whom will be affected by the decision we have taken.

Big employers such as the port and universities rely on us having good trading and research relations with the EU and one in ten workers at Southampton General is an EU citizen. We need to make sure that the Brexit negotiations achieve the best deal for Britain and for our economy.

One worrying aspect of how the Government has dealt with Brexit so far is its stance on EU citizens already living in the UK.

Many of us have friends or family from the European Union. They have now been thrown into uncertainty by Theresa May’s decision to use them as a Brexit bargaining chip. These are people who have lived and worked in the UK, in some cases for decades, and they have made their lives, homes and families here. It is simply not right that they should be used in negotiations in this way and I have been pushing the government to protect their status.
issues.economy: Big employers such as the port and universities rely on us having good trading and research relations with the EU and one in ten workers at Southampton General is an EU citizen. We need to make sure that the Brexit negotiations achieve the best deal for Britain and for our economy.
issues.government: One worrying aspect of how the Government has dealt with Brexit so far is its stance on EU citizens already living in the UK.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have made it very clear that I will fight to protect the rights and futures of EU citizens living in the UK and if re-elected on Thursday 8th of June will speak out to get the best deal for Southampton and all its residents in the upcoming Brexit negotiations.

politicalExperience.role: Councillor, Council Leader, Member of Parliament
